TopicTitle: Why is E.V.A not fully implemented?

Articles.Content:
Why is E.V.A not fully implemented? I thought it was, if not what is wrong with E.V.A?

Proof why it\'s not fully implemented: http://kspwiki.nexisonline.net/wiki/Planned_features

What? EVA is fully in the game. Someone probably forgot to change the color.

OR...

It might be because kerbals can't do much during an eva right now, developers want to add more actions.

Edited August 4, 2012 by ForumHelper

I\'d say it\'s not fully implemented. There are things like repair, sample collection, flag planting (if any of those are planned) that could still be added to it. As well as this, there ought to be a revision of the controls, which I personally have been going on about since .16 came out, since the rotation control is very frustrating at times, when trying to perform inverted operations. http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=16923.0
Surely EVA will be one of those features they add bits to as mini-updates?
There is still a lot of stuff to add. Like scientific experiments and planting flags. Also, the MMU controls are very -- well -- not ready... I'd say.
I'd like a working hatch, and true interiors. I suspect that RC1062 is correct, and EVA will gradually improve as the game is updated.

I\'d say it\'s not fully implemented. There are things like repair, sample collection, flag planting (if any of those are planned) that could still be added to it. As well as this, there ought to be a revision of the controls, which I personally have been going on about since .16 came out, since the rotation control is very frustrating at times, when trying to perform inverted operations. http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=16923.0

I think we really ought to leave it up to Squad to determine what is meant by "fully implemented," don't you? None of us have any idea if those actions will be possible on EVA. Squad may not even know for sure right now. KSP is currently in alpha, nothing will be implemented overnight.
